required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biopsy Size and Pain Perception During Colposcopic Biopsy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Study: Patients' With or Without Tenaculum Placement and Intracervical Blockage/or Not During Colposcopic Biopsy

lead_sponsor.agency: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will investigate patients pain and biopsy size during colposcopic biopsy. The investigators will use tenaculum randomized patient with or without intracervical blockage.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was designed four arms. The investigators will perform colposcopy because of various causes. The first arm is used tenaculum and performed intracervical blockage. The second arm is not used tenaculum and performed intracervical blockage. The third arm is used tenaculum and not performed intracervical blockage. The fourth arm is not used tenaculum and not performed intracervical blockage and then we will study patients pain and biopsy size during colposcopic biopsy. Pain reduce and biopsy size are very important for patient and diagnose of the cervix cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Are patients' biopsy sizes associate with tenaculum. Milimeter will be used for biopsy size.
Are patients' biopsy sizes associate with analgesic. Milimeter will be used for biopsy size.

secondary_outcome.description: Are patients' pain perceptions associate with analgesic. Linear Visual Analog Scale will be used for pain perception.
Are patients' pain perceptions associate with teanaculum. Linear Visual Analog Scale will be used for pain perception.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-80 year-old women who had colposcopic biopsy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Had orthopedical problems
- Analgesic allergy
- Have previous cone biopsy
- Analgesic use until six hours before colposcopy
- Advanced cervicovaginal atrophy
- Linear Visual Analog Score for pain is used
